issues.title: Out of memory: crash when show many animations frequently (RAM can't release after animation done)
issues.body:
*** Config Info ***
Version used: com.airbnb.android:lottie:3.4.0
appcompat: androidx

minSdkVersion 16
targetSdkVersion 29
compileSdkVersion = 29
buildToolsVersion = "29.0.2"

Device used: Asus Asus_X008D (Android 7.0) --> I catched crash on this device easier (128 MB ram for app)

*** Sample project: https://github.com/xensius/TestLottie


** Describe the bug:
My app shows many different gift animations frequently. ex: A,B,C,D, ... is gift animation. My app will play animation A then animation A done, app will play animation B .... then for C, D, ...

i logged usage ram info, and i see when animation play RAM usage increased but when animation is done, RAM usage is not released or hard to release and make a crash when get full RAM.
i checked on devices: the issue occurs on Redmi 3s (Android 6.0), Samsung GT-I9505 (Android 5.01), Asus Asus_X008D (Android 7.0) but Lottie works OK about RAM usage on Samsung A20s (Android 9.0).


Thank team very much and hope get your reply soon!!!

issues.title: It seems has ZipperDown Vulnerability
issues.body:
Hi Team,
First of all Lottie is an amazing rendering library.
But we received a security reminder about ZipperDown, the following is the description, Recommendation and secure code:
**Description**
Android provides the java.util.zip package, which contains classes such
as ZipInputStream that enable an App to read, create and modify ZIP
archives. When using this API to unzip an archive, it does not protect against file names in the archive that trigger a path traversal (such as ../..). This allows a malicious archive to overwrite files within the
App's container when the archive gets unzipped.
The Zipperdown exploit leverages this issue to potentially allow a remote attacker who has the ability to inject a malicious archive into the App (for example because of unencrypted connections initiated by the App) to overwrite files. Depending on the App's functionality and how the API is being used, it may allow the attacker to perform a remote code execution attack against the App, and thereby get full access to the App's data.

**Recommendation**
When unzipping an archive, always validate the compressed files' paths and reject any path that has a path traversal (such as ../..). Simply looking for .. characters in the compressed file's path may not
be enough to prevent path traversal issues, and a more robust approach is described in the "Secure Code" section below.

You can found secure code in this link
https://wiki.sei.cmu.edu/confluence/display/java/IDS04-J.+Safely+extract+files+from+ZipInputStream

issues.title: Out of memory: crash when show many animations frequently (RAM can't release after animation done)
issues.body:
** Lottie v3.0.1 and also on Lottie v3.4.0

** Describe the bug:
My app shows many different gift animations frequently. ex: A,B,C,D, ... is gift animation. My app will play animation A then animation A done, app will play animation B .... then for C, D, ...

i logged usage ram info, and i see when animation play RAM usage increased but when animation is done, RAM usage is not released or hard to release and make a crash when get full RAM.
i checked on devices: the issue occurs on Redmi 3s (Android 6.0), Samsung GT-I9505 (Android 5.01), Asus Asus_X008D (Android 7.0) but Lottie works OK about RAM usage on Samsung A20s (Android 9.0).

i used codes to playAnimation with Lottie:
```
            lottieAnimationView.setComposition(composition);            

            lottieAnimationView.setProgress(0f);
            lottieAnimationView.resumeAnimation();

```
and listen AnimationEnded by `lottieAnimationView.addAnimatorListener` to play next gift animation.

Thank team very much and hope get your reply soon!!!

issues.title: Upgrade Okio to 2.x
issues.body:
We are writing an a Kotlin app that uses Lottie and OkHTTP. We are considering replacing Lottie due to the project's reliance on Okio 1.x. This causes a circular dependency that is caught by Gradle when using OkHTTP 4.x and Lottie in the same project. I see that about a year ago the project added a comment `   // Do not ugprade to 2.0 because it will bring in Kotlin as a transitive dependency.` to the project's `build.gradle`. Has anything changed? 

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Clone https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/fenix
2. Change the [mockwebserver value](https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/fenix/blob/a9692d9bce69688226086f94b0284831b06ba533/buildSrc/src/main/java/Dependencies.kt#L43) to a current 4.x release.  ex: `4.5.0`
3. Compile debug app
4. Circular dependency error from the compiler. OkHTTP wants Okio 2.x and Lottie wants Okio 1.x

https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/fenix/issues/8169#issuecomment-600231224

Android 10

issues.title: Memory Leak happends with OnCompositionLoadedListener
onAnimationEnd called twice when system animations are disabled
issues.body:
** If you don't use this template, your issue will be closed **

**Checklist**

1. Fork this repository into your account.
2. Reproduce your issue in the issue-repro module. Issues without a repro in the issue-repro 
   module may be auto-closed.

**Link to fork with a repro in the issue-repro module**
https://github.com/BoD/lottie-android/blob/master/issue-repro/src/main/java/com/airbnb/lottie/issues/MainActivity.kt

**Describe the bug**
When system animations are disabled, `onAnimationEnd` is called twice

**Steps To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

- Call `setAnimation on` a `LottieAnimationView`
- Add an animation listener
- Disable system animations on the device
- Run the app and notice that `onAnimationEnd` is called twice

It is correctly called only once, when system animations are not disabled.

issues.title: Autoplay not working on saved view instance
issues.body:
**Link to demo app for the issue**
https://github.com/CodeRedDev/LottieAutoplay

**Describe the bug**
In some cases it may be necessary to store the instance of a fragments view to save time and memory recreating it (see [StackOverflow backed by Ian Lake](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54581071/fragments-destroyed-recreated-with-jetpacks-android-navigation-components/55039009#55039009) ). In these cases `autoPlay` would fail on a re-attachment of the fragment.

This is caused by

https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/blob/3a5d706bad862a4eec9e3b4bc10a0c693077987e/lottie/src/main/java/com/airbnb/lottie/LottieAnimationView.java#L310-L311

Although in a normal scenario it will work in the cases like described above it will fail to play the animation and you would have to manually call `playAnimation()` in `onResume()` or the like. Also if you look at it from a logical point of view it does not make a lot of sense that `autoPlay` should only be applied once.

**Steps To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Checkout the demo app
2. Click on 'bottom nav 2'
2. Click on 'bottom nav 1'
4. See the animation not playing

Save play state in SavedState even if view was detached from the window first (#1442)

Test failed before but passes now

Fixes #1428

issues.title: Animator scale off in developer settings no longer calls end listener (snapshot)
issues.body:
We have a screen where we depend on having a certain lottie animation to end. This means we have a `AnimatorListener` and wait for the `onAnimationEnd`.

In 3.1.0-SNAPSHOT, because of #1349, if we have animator scale off in developer settings, the animation stops and the listener never gets called.

Is this something that lottie should fix (by calling the listener anyway) or should we address this in the app? What would make the most sense?

issues.title: Lottie scale types
issues.body:
For some reasons, our Android team needs to use FIT_XY type of Lottie. But I found Lottie doesn't support non-original aspect ratio scale types. However, our iOS team  doesn't have this problem.
Why does Lottie on Android only support CENTER_CROP or CENTER_INSIDE? Is there anything that iOS can manage but Android can not?

issues.title: Extreme lag in 3.0.0+ and higher, smooth in 2.8.0
issues.body:
I've got an animation, purely vector based with 0 png/webp images.
It lags extremely much with 3.0.0 or higher (i've tested all versions above 3.0.0, including the newest 3.1.0 snapshot).
With 2.8.0 it works smoothly and has no lag.

I've tried to create a completely basic new project, imported only Lottie and the 1 animation, and can recreate it.

https://lottiefiles.com/share/OXAN93

I've tried various combinations of forcing different RenderModes, but can't seem to get it to work smoothly.
I've also tried to add it as both a raw json file in assets, as a ZIP file in assets, and putting it in the raw folder. No change.

Its fine on the lottiefiles test website, but not on Android. I've tested on emulator and 2 different real devices, it's the same.

Is there anything other then setRenderMode that i can tweak? I couldn't find anything

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fixed render mode (#1377)

This change (https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/pull/1190) was supposed to revert to software rendering when the device can't allocate a hardware buffer large enough for the animation. However, this would also trigger before a composition loads and the view was set to wrap_content. The width and heigh would be 0 which would cause Android to noop the drawing cache. However, the previous logic here would think that the drawing cache failed to allocate because it was too large.

I also added some systrace markers and added a default animation view to the issue repro module.

Fixes #1374

issues.title: ANR with match_parent in some lotties
issues.body:
On at least on a Samsung s8 plus with Android 7 some bigger lotties are crashing the application during the animation, this happens for LottieAnimationView with the layout_width of the view as match_parent or 0dp using constraintStart_toStart and constraintEnd_toEndOf parent and a fixed layout_height

We tried with all 3.0.+ versions of the lib and the same issue happens

In our case to reproduce this issue its only need to open the app and even before the first loop ends the app crashes. Sample project attached [lottie_anr.zip](https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/files/3456117/lottie_anr.zip) and the traces.txt from the crash [traces.txt](https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/files/3456145/traces.txt)

issues.title: LottieAnimationView.removeAllUpdateListeners removes internal listeners, breaking core behavior.
issues.body:
**Sample Project**
I used the `LottieSample` and introduce a 1 line change there https://github.com/pawelkw/lottie-android/commit/0de9c8bfdb525a9a72d51dfdf679a11d69bd4329.

**Describe the bug**
Calling `LottieAnimationView.removeAllUpdateListeners` removes an internal listener set in `LottieDrawable` constructor (https://github.com/pawelkw/lottie-android/blob/master/lottie/src/main/java/com/airbnb/lottie/LottieDrawable.java#L117). This breaks all animations. They no longer play and don't react to any start/resume calls.

**Steps To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start `LottieSample`.
2. Open any `PlayerActivity` based animation example. I.e. "delivery car icon".
3. Animation does not work.

**Solution:**
Client interface listener calls should not affect internally set listeners.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Prevent removeAllUdpateListeners from breaking the world (#1354)

Fixes #1337

issues.title: Changing the order of the bodymovin json causes the library to crash
issues.body:
I'm making some changes to the bodymovin json which causes the properties to get reordered. I've created a simple bodymovin json to illustrate this issue. 

This is the original bodymovin json: 
`"shapes": [
        {
          "ty": "gr",
          "it": [
            {
              "ty": "rc",
              "d": 1,
              "s": {
                "a": 0,
                "k": [
                  682.273,
                  196.422
                ],
                "ix": 2
              },
              "p": {
                "a": 0,
                "k": [
                  0,
                  0
                ],
                "ix": 3
              },
              "r": {
                "a": 0,
                "k": 0,
                "ix": 4
              },
              "nm": "Rectangle Path 1",
              "mn": "ADBE Vector Shape - Rect",
              "hd": false
            },`

This is the modified json:
`"shapes": [
        {
          "ty": "gr",
          "it": [
            {
              "r": {
                "a": 0,
                "k": 0,
                "ix": 4
              },
              "ty": "rc",
              "d": 1,
              "s": {
                "a": 0,
                "k": [
                  682.273,
                  196.422
                ],
                "ix": 2
              },
              "p": {
                "a": 0,
                "k": [
                  0,
                  0
                ],
                "ix": 3
              },
              "nm": "Rectangle Path 1",
              "mn": "ADBE Vector Shape - Rect",
              "hd": false
            },`

Here are the full bodymovin files as well as the AE file:
[Archive.zip](https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/files/4289994/Archive.zip)

All I I changed is moving the "r" property before the "ty" property. This is the simplest change I've made to the bodymovin json to reproduce this issue. However, I've also noticed other cases where the app wouldn't crash but the shape wouldn't appear. 

What version of Lottie did you test this on?
3.3.0

What version of Android did you test this on?
Android 10

Logcat: 
`    java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'com.airbnb.lottie.animation.keyframe.BaseKeyframeAnimation com.airbnb.lottie.model.animatable.AnimatableFloatValue.createAnimation()' on a null object reference

        at com.airbnb.lottie.model.layer.CompositionLayer.<init>(CompositionLayer.java:56)

issues.title: [LottieAnimationView] repeatCount is not taken into account
issues.body:
** If you don't use this template, your issue will be closed **

**Checklist**

1. My animation doesn't use any [unsupported features](http://airbnb.io/lottie/#/supported-features).
2. I know what part of my animation doesn't work.
3. I have created a simplified version of my animation 
4. I have attached the AEP file (as a zip file so it can be attached) that only has the part of the animation that doesn't work.

**Describe the bug**
The repeat count is not taken into account if we start the animation when the LottieAnimationView is not visible

**What version of Lottie did you test this on?**
3.3.1

**What version of Android did you test this on?**
Android 9.0

**Steps To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. create LottieAnimationView
2. hide the view
3. set repeatCount at 2 (or more) 
4. start playAnimation()
5. show the view
6. the animation is played only once


**Screenshots**

```
    fun playAnimation() {
        if(lottie_view.isShown) {
            lottie_view.repeatCount = 2
            lottie_view.playAnimation()
            // HERE Animation will be trigger three times
        }
        else {
            lottie_view.repeatCount = 2
            lottie_view.playAnimation()
            // HERE The animation is not played immediately, it will be played
            // only when the view is visible, but however it will be played only
            // once instead of the 3 times desired
        }
    }
```

*Lottie is supported and developed on nights and weekends. Please consider [sponsoring Lottie](https://github.com/users/gpeal/sponsorship) to prioritize this issue and help support this issue as well as future investments.*

issues.title: LottieCompositionFactory Async methods do not load animation on API < 24 when composition is set outside of LottieListener
issues.body:
Tested on APIs: 19, 21, 24 and 29
Lottie version: 3.3.1

This is a follow up issue for https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/issues/1491, since that contained info which turned out to be unrelated.

### The problem:
While creating this issue and the test project, I've discovered the real problem: 
I'm calling `setImageDrawable(lottieDrawable)` outside of the `LottieListener`. When moving this within the listener's callback, it works fine on all API levels tested.

I'll leave this test project and issue up, since it is strange how this approach works on api 24+ but not on api < 24 🤔 
I am happy to accept its a case of 'works as expected' though and for the ticket to simply be closed without further action.

Test project: https://github.com/StefanDeBruijn/TestLottieComposition

Screenshots:

| API 19        | API 21           | API 24           |
| ------------- |:-------------:| :-------------:| 
|![api19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7021747/73447800-65f51e00-4357-11ea-8623-9aeaa5c0a7e6.png)|![api21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7021747/73447804-67bee180-4357-11ea-9e2c-2365d2af7e2e.png)|![api24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7021747/73447810-6988a500-4357-11ea-8bf2-2f4cbf36c032.png)|

Details about the test project:
All related code is found in `FirstFragment.kt`. 
Code that causes the error is marked with // FIXME

It loads both our custom Lottie animation (`pull_to_refresh.json`) and another random animation from LottieFiles (`control.json`), in various ways (`fromRawRes`, `fromRawResSync`, `fromAsset` and the standard XML way).

issues.title: Animation unexpectedly is interrupted
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
I have project, a mobile app for which I recently created a download screen animation. In ios everything works as it should, and in android there were problems with one of the elements of animation.

The animation contains a pattern that should be smoothly shaded in blue. All design consists of a pattern and a blue circle, the pattern is a mask for a circle, the circle increases from 0% to 100% for several seconds and this blue pattern has to be visible until the end of animation. The pattern I drew in Illustrator and exported to after effects, there created a blue circle for which the pattern made a mask. As a result, after exporting the json file, the pattern begins to paint blue and is interrupted on the middle of the animation, just disappearing.

For the experiment I created arbitrary figures and red circle, arbitrary figures I made mask for red circle and after rendering these figures are painted red as I need to.

In animation, I used Alpha Matte to create a mask. I checked supported features, Alpha Matte is supported. I think the problem is the pattern, but I don 't know what 's wrong with it, please tell me. In all animation I have 2 such patterns, this one works quite badly, and the other little. Help us find a solution.

The question is why does the pattern disappear on half the animation, and the arbitrary figures drawn in after effects work normally?!

I attached the file source after effects, json file and video as the animation should work and how it works on android (samsung galaxy s8).

Please respond as soon as possible because in a few days launch the application in the play market. Thank you.

**What version of Lottie did you test this on?**
Version: 5.5.2

**What version of Android did you test this on?**
9

**Steps To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Download json file to android phone
2. Watch the animation interrupt

**Screenshots**
Ae, json
 and video: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1-VtUX0Sm16UvDa1VCKWcNTbIjo6pJ658

issues.title: Cropped lottie animation
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
In the screenshot, you see an activity. The top half contains a `LottieAnimationView` which starts at the very top of the screen. The lottie animation seems to be cropped internally with different behavior on different devices (screen sizes). However, the size of the `LottieAnimationView` stays the same.

At the beginning of the animation, the line actually appears at the very top of the screen and disappears to the very top again when the animation ends. However, for some weird reason, the line in the animation gets shorter in the middle of the animation. The line should reach to the very top of the screen at all times.

Please see the attached files for a better understanding. The screencast video shows the weird behavior. There is also a video on how the animation should look like. Also, please see the project files for the full code.

NOTE: The same animation files are used on iOS and are displayed as expected. The problem seems to be on the Android side rather than the animations themselves.

We've tried all kinds of different configurations of the `LottieAnimationView` with `width`, `height`, `scaleType`, `lottie_scale` with no success.

**What version of Lottie did you test this on?**
3.0.7 (and about the last 10 releases before that, same results everywhere)

**What version of Android did you test this on?**
API 21, API 28, API Q (and others, same results everywhere)

**Steps To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Launch the provided sample app.
2. Click on the right or left side of the screen to show the next or previous lottie animation. You can also swipe the switch the screen (same behavior).
3. Depending on your test device, the line on the second screen is cropped to a certain degree.
4. Switching back and forth to the second screen will show, that the animation actually reaches to the very top of the screen. 
5. The third screen shows a weird glitch on the checkmark, which appears briefly before it should. Maybe this glitch has the same cause than the second animation.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50235418/63765430-47cb5380-c8c9-11e9-955c-da8007d45b83.png)

**Attachments**
https://www.dropbox.com/s/7qjxgk0ydricvcr/lottie-test-files.zip?dl=0
- AEP file 
- Screenshots
- Screencast
- Android Studio example project

**Describe the bug**
We're using both dynamic text and coloring some elements in our animation at runtime using `ValueCallback`. Unfortunately, it looks like it's impossible to target the dynamic texts. We have tried: 

```
        animation.addValueCallback(
            KeyPath("**"),
            LottieProperty.STROKE_COLOR
        ) {
            context!!.getThemeColor(android.R.attr.textColorPrimary)
        }
        animation.addValueCallback(
            KeyPath("**"),
            LottieProperty.COLOR
        ) {
            context!!.getThemeColor(android.R.attr.textColorPrimary)
        }
```

and it colors everything else in the animation except for our texts.

api 23 - 28

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fix rotations on solid layers (#598)

Prior to this, the transform matrix got mapped to a solid layer's bounds. However, if there is a rotation then the final shape won't be a rect so we need to map the points instead.

Fixes #587
